<topcClas>Social attitudes and behaviour - Society and culture</topcClas>         <topcClas>Social indicators and quality of life - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>This data can be used to analyse the relationship between personal well-being and household income and expenditure. It was the source for a recent ONS article looking at how income, the distribution of income across society, source of income and spending affect life satisfaction, a sense that the things we do in life are worthwhile, and levels of happiness and anxiety.</abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Topics covered by the dataset include: <br> <br> <ul><li>personal well-being</li><li>household income</li><li>household expenditure</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2011-04-01T00:00:00Z">April 2011</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2012-03-01T00:00:00Z">March 2012</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>Countries</geogUnit>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <anlyUnit> Families/households</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Adults aged 16+ living in private households in Great Britain.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Cross-sectional (one-time) study</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Multi-stage stratified random sample</sampProc>         <deviat>13,255 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Diaries</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Please see the documentation.</weight>         <cleanOps>A</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage.
